headline: Airline Stocks Bounce Back on Monday's Trading: Here's Why
summary: Airline stocks such as DAL, UAL, AAL and LUV rebounded as easing Middle East tensions drove oil prices down, lifting hopes for better margins ahead.

headline: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From United Airlines’s Q1 Earnings Call
summary: United Airlines delivered first quarter results that surpassed Wall Street’s revenue and profit expectations, despite operating in a softer demand environment. Management attributed the company’s resilience to an increased focus on brand loyal customers, with CEO Scott Kirby highlighting, “United’s performance is strong even in this weak environment because we’ve won the battle for brand loyal customers.” The quarter was shaped by disciplined cost management, a shift in capacity away from off-pe
